textbooks.title: Project Leadership: From Theory to Practice
textbooks.author: Pinto, J.K., Thoms, P., Trailer, J., Palmer, T., Govekar, M.

topics: Behavioral and Trait Perspectives on Leading and Managing
readings: Zaleznik A., (1992). Managers and leaders: Are they different? HBR
Kotter, J. P. (1990). What leaders really do. HBR March

topics: Self-Awareness (Part 1): Being a Leader and Your Attitudes Toward Change
readings: Whetten & Cameron Chapter 1: Developing Self Awareness

topics: Self-Awareness (Part 2): Your Core Values, Interpersonal Style (DISC), and Your VMLQ (360Â° Feedback)
readings: Eurich, T. (2018) What Self-Awareness Really Is (and How to Cultivate It), HBR.
Hougard, R., Carter, J., Afton, M. (2018). Self-awareness can help leaders more than an MBA can. HBR, January.
Whetten & Cameron Chapter 2 - Managing Personal Stress

topics: Communication and Coaching: A Foundation for Influencing

readings: Chapter 2 - Classical Theories of Leadership in Pinto, J. K., Thomas, P., Trailer, J., Palmer, T., & Govekar, M. (1998). Project Leadership: From Theory to Practice.
Dominick, P. (2008). The Vigilance Project case
SSS Software in-basket exercise (Whetten & Cameron, pages 21-33)

topics: Course Wrap-Up: Meeting with your Board of Directors

assignments.name: Skills Analysis Paper (U, Inc.)
assignments.description: An assessment of your strengths and development opportunities in relation to the skill areas discussed in class and in relation to your overall objectives (approx. 8 pages, 1.5 inch spacing, 1 inch margins).

assignments.name: Skills Development Plan and Report
assignments.description: A summary of the steps and actions you took to capitalize on your strengths and improve on other skills you identified in your Skills Analysis Paper. (approx. pages 3-5 pages, 1.5 inch spacing, 1 inch margins).

policies.attendance: Attendance is mandatory for live sessions.
policies.late_work: Timely posting will enrich your and class members' learning and will provide me with an opportunity to engage in discussions with you.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: This course spans thirteen weeks with a different learning module covered each week.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

instructor.name: Kalim Rayburn
instructor.office_hours: Tuesdays, 7:30 pm - 8:30 pm; Thursdays, 5:00 pm - 6:00 pm

_metadata.course_description: This course develops your leading and influencing capabilities.
learning_outcomes: Critique your leadership strengths and identify opportunities to develop personal/professional areas for growth.
Engage in the processes of personal leader development.
Distinguish among key theories and principles used to study leaders and leadership and apply these theories and principles to real-world situations.
Utilize key skills and competencies to lead, influence, and build relationships.
